In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a possible implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(strip(lowercase(col)), r"\s|-", "_")
end
```
This function first calls `lowercase` on the input column name to convert it to lowercase. It then uses `replace` to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces and replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore. Finally, it calls `strip` to remove any remaining whitespace characters from the result.

You can test this function by calling it with a sample column name:
```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```
